short_text: Uses two-dimensional "sprites", 2D images created and used on a flat plane, as opposed to the three-dimensional models or environments found in 3D games.

short_text: Work centered on following a character through the ups and downs during a notable part of their life. There's often more of an emphasis on characterization, relationships, and a series of dramatic events than on strict adherence to conventional story structures and plotlines.

Games can take a long time to complete since the amount of micromanagement needed to sustain an empire increases as the empire grows.

short_text: The goal is getting the highest score possible.

short_text: Utilized combat systems where characters or teams take turns making their next move. Turns often have no time limit, allowing for a greater opportunity to think about strategy. The opposite of real-time combat.

short_text: Yaoi, also known as boys' love, is a genre of work involving romance between men. The word originates in Japan and is typically seen alongside an anime style.

short_text: Games that don't have vilolence as a primary component.

short_text: An otome game is a story based video game that is targeted towards the female market. Generally one of the goals, besides the main plot goal, is to develop a romantic relationship between the female player character and one of several male or female characters.

short_text: Games that are unearthly and bizarre in theme, aesthetic or story.

title: Shoot 'Em Up

title: FPS

short_text: Something out of the ordinary, or peculiar. Often far beyond one's imagination.

short_text: Games and software made with GameMaker or GameMaker: Studio.

short_text: Dating sims (or dating simulations) are a video game subgenre of simulation games, usually Japanese, with romantic elements. The most common objective of dating sims is to date, usually choosing from among several characters, and to achieve a romantic relationship.
title: Dating Sim

short_text: Projects inspired by the 16 bit console generation from the late 80s and early 90s. Including the consoles Super Nintendo, Sega Genesis, and PC Engine/TurboGrafx-16.
title: 16-bit

short_text: Ren'py is a free and open source Visual Novel Creator.
title: renpy

short_text: Near infinitely replayable games that usually feature, random generation, perma-death, and brutal difficulty.
title: Roguelike

short_text: Subgenre of Horror, where player's character is usually more vulnerable and under-armed, usually focusing on evasion, stealth and/or puzzle-solving, rather than combat.
title: Survival Horror

short_text: Contains lesbian, gay, bisexual, and/or transgender characters or plot lines.
title: LGBT

short_text: Story based experiences
title: Narrative

short_text: A subgenre of the adventure game, point-and-click games typically involve interacting with background objects, talking to non-player characters, and using an item inventory to solve puzzles that allow the player to progress through the story.
title: Point & Click

short_text: Games that defy the traditional approach to game design and offer unique, interesting and often strange experiences.
title: Experimental

short_text: Games with a woman as the main character.
title: Female Protagonist

short_text: In the style of games made the 8-bit generation of game consoles & computers, or sometimes authentically created to run on original hardware. Common 8-Bit consoles include the Nintendo Entertainment System, Sega Master System, and the Commodore 64
title: 8-Bit

short_text: Inspired by (or directly containing elements of) storytelling and visual design that are otherwise most commonly seen in Japanese animation.
title: Anime

short_text: Games that can be played by more than one player, either locally or online.
title: Multiplayer

short_text: Games that feature 3D art that has a low polygon count per model. Generally used as an artistic style.

short_text: Games made with ASCII/Enterbrain/Kadokawa Games' RPG Maker series of game engines. Includes, but is not limited to the following:
title: RPG Maker

short_text: Usually containing sexual themes, content or more. Not safe for work most of the time.
title: Erotic

short_text: Either prominently containing or entirely themed around romance, this genre is typically focused on interpersonal romantic relationships between characters and the player.
title: Romance

short_text: Games where you discover new locations by traveling around in the game's environment
title: Exploration

short_text: Games with a heavy focus on storytelling and narrative.
title: Story Rich

short_text: Simple, fast-paced games with colorful graphics and catchy audio, that require few or no explanations, can be played in short bursts, and usually require a lot of skill. Similar in style and spirit with the arcade game cabinets of the 80s and 90s.
title: Arcade

short_text: Endearing or adorable projects
title: Cute

short_text: Games with a distinctive mood, with themes of romance, mystery, or nostalgia
title: Atmospheric

short_text: You are looking through the eyes of the main character.
title: First-Person

short_text: Games that try to simulate real-world activities (like driving vehicles or living the life of someone else) with as much realism as possible. Simulators generally require more study and orientation than arcade games, and the best simulators are also educational.
title: Simulation

short_text: When jumping over obstacles is one of the main actions, challenges, or mechanics of the game.
title: Platformer

short_text: For that old school look and feel.
title: Retro

short_text: Made in Unity
title: Unity

short_text: Visual novels are interactive stories. They focus mainly on character development and plot rather than action and gameplay mechanics.
title: Visual Novel

short_text: Games that challenge the player with critical thinking to solve levels.
title: Puzzle

short_text: Like when your dimensions come in three? Try out some of these top 3d games on itch.io.

short_text: Pixel Art refers to the charming, simplistic, retro/renaissance style of very-low-resolution graphics, such as from the 1977-1995 Atari, GameBoy, & Super Nintendo (SNES) eras.
title: Pixel Art

short_text: Games that aim to startle and unnerve the player.
title: Horror

short_text: Games that can be played alone
title: Singleplayer
